meanings.definition: The part of the body between the neck and upper arm.
meanings.sent1: She felt pain in her shoulder after carrying heavy bags.
meanings.sent2: He shrugged his shoulder to show he didn't know the answer.
meanings.sent3: The little girl rested her head on her father's shoulder during the movie.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility sat heavily on his shoulder.
meanings.sent5: The football player's shoulder pads protected him during the game.

meanings.definition: A cut of meat from the upper part of an animal's foreleg.
meanings.sent1: The chef seasoned the shoulder of lamb before roasting it.
meanings.sent2: The butcher recommended the pork shoulder for the barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The family enjoyed a delicious roast shoulder for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The slow-cooked beef shoulder melted in your mouth.
meanings.sent5: The shoulder steak was tender and flavorful.

meanings.definition: To carry a load on one's shoulder.
meanings.sent1: He would shoulder the heavy backpack during the hike.
meanings.sent2: She decided to shoulder the responsibility of organizing the event.
meanings.sent3: The young boy tried to shoulder the oversized bag but stumbled.
meanings.sent4: She had to shoulder the burden of caring for her sick grandmother.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to shoulder the weight of the project deadline.

meanings.definition: To push or jostle with one's shoulder.
meanings.sent1: He would shoulder his way through the crowded room.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally shouldered the door open with her hands full.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy would shoulder into the other dogs during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete shouldered past his opponents to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The impatient commuter shouldered through the train station crowd.
